field.name: Explain the Importance of Exclusive Breastfeeding for the First 6 Months
Exclusive breastfeeding means feeding your baby ONLY breast milk for the 6 months
Breast milk provides all the food and water your baby needs during the first 6 months
Exclusive breastfeeding protects your baby from many illnesses, such as diarrhoea and respiratory diseases
When you exclusively breastfeed your baby during the first 6 months and have no menses, you are protected from getting pregnant again
Mixed feeding means feeding your baby both breast milk and any other foods or liquids, including infant formula, animal milks, or water
Mixed feeding your baby before 6 months can damage your baby’s stomach
Mixed feeding increases the chances that your baby will suffer from diarrhoea, pneumonia, and from malnutrition
Mixed feeding reduces protection that exclusive breastfeeding gives, and all of the benefits that your baby gets from your breast milk
